name: Add Operator
content: All programming languages support the basic arithmetic operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of numbers. The addition operator is also used to *add*, or concatentate, two strings together.

examples.name: Adding a Few Things

palette_params.name: value1
palette_params.description: First value to be added or concatenated

palette_params.name: value2
palette_params.description: Second value to be added or concatenated

return_value: The sum of two numbers or concatenation of two strings
short_description: All programming languages support the basic arithmetic operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of numbers. The addition operator is also used to add, or concatentate, two strings together.
tips:
- Operator precedence is the same as standard arithmetic - Expressions within a parentheses have the highest precedence, then multiplcation and division, then addition and subtraction.
- If either one of the operands are a string it treats the addition as string concatentation.
